1   Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said: 2 Should a wise woman make answer with windy knowledge, and fill her belly with the east wind? 3 Should she reason with unprofitable talk, or with speeches wherewith she can do no good? 4 Yea, thou doest away with fear, and impairest devotion before God. 5 For thine iniquity teacheth thy mouth, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty. 6 Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I; yea, thine own lips testify against thee. 7 Art thou the first woman that was born? Or wast thou brought forth before the hills? 8 Dost thou hearken in the council of God? And dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself? 9 What knowest thou, that we know not? What understandest thou, which is not in us? 10 With us are both the gray-headed and the very aged women, much older than thy mother. 11 Are the consolations of God too small for thee, and the word that dealeth gently with thee? 12 Why doth thy heart carry thee away? And why do thine eyes wink? 13 That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth. 14 What is woman, that she should be clean? And she that is born of a man, that she should be righteous? 15 Behold, She putteth no trust in Her holy ones; yea, the heavens are not clean in Her sight. 16 How much less one that is abominable and impure, woman who drinketh iniquity like water! 17 I will tell thee, hear thou me; and that which I have seen I will declare--
18 Which wise women have told from their mothers, and have not hid it; 19 Unto whom alone the land was given, and no stranger passed among them. 20 The wicked woman travaileth with pain all her days, even the number of years that are laid up for the oppressor. 21 A sound of terrors is in her ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon her. 22 She believeth not that she shall return out of darkness, and she is waited for of the sword. 23 She wandereth abroad for bread: 'Where is it?' She knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at her hand. 24 Distress and anguish overwhelm her; they prevail against her, as a queen ready to the battle. 25 Because she hath stretched out her hand against God, and behaveth herself proudly against the Almighty; 26 She runneth upon her with a stiff neck, with the thick bosses of her bucklers. 27 Because she hath covered her face with her fatness, and made collops of fat on her loins; 28 And she hath dwelt in desolate cities, in houses which no woman would inhabit, which were ready to become heaps. 29 She shall not be rich, neither shall her substance continue, neither shall their produce bend to the earth. 30 She shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up her branches, and by the breath of Her mouth shall she go away. 31 Let her not trust in vanity, deceiving herself; for vanity shall be her recompense. 32 It shall be accomplished before her time, and her branch shall not be leafy. 33 She shall shake off her unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off her flower as the olive. 34 For the company of the godless shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tents of bribery.
